yay 0.0.9013
  • Reference

Read in a file from a GitLab repository

Source: R/yay.gen.R
gl_file_raw.Rd

Downloads the file under the specified path from a GitLab repository via GitLab's v4 RESTful API and returns its content.

Usage

gl_file_raw(
  path,
  id_proj,
  ref = NULL,
  base_url = pal::pkg_config_val("gitlab_base_url"),
  token = pal::pkg_config_val("gitlab_token"),
  max_tries = 3L
)

Arguments

path

File path, relative to the repository root. A character scalar.

id_proj

GitLab project identifier. An integerish number.

ref

Git revision expression matching the desired Git tree object, e.g. a ref name (branch, tag, etc.), a commit identifier, or another symbolic reference like "HEAD~10". A character scalar. Note that the GitLab API doesn't support every type of revision expression.

base_url

Base URL to the GitLab v4 RESTful API root.

token

GitLab access token used for authentication

max_tries

Maximum number of attempts to retry in case of an HTTP error. An integerish scalar.

Value

A character scalar if path refers to a text file, otherwise a raw vector.

See also

Other gitlabr: gl_file_write(), gl_url()

Examples

yay::gl_file_raw(path = "DESCRIPTION",
                 id_proj = 24995012) |>
  cat()
